text: On tap at Dragonmead. Deep brown pour with a white head. Cocoa and caramel aroma. Flavor is caramel, roasty, smoky, with touches of toffee, butterscotch, and red grape. Pretty nice.

On tap, pours a clear amber with an off white head, the aroma was pretty malty with a good amount of sweetness, the flavor has a caramel front end with some toffee in the finish, still sweet overall, not all that great.

On tap at Dragonmead Brewpub.  Translucent amber with a thin white head.  Aroma of toffee, peated malt and mild fruit.  Taste of toffee and mild fruit with a hint of peat and a semi-dry finish.  Kinda one-dimensional.

UPDATED: JUL 25, 2011 On tap at Dragonmead; pour is frothy beige, with both fine and large bubbled character present. This brew retains fairly well. On the nose; caramel malt sweetness, coupled with smoke and dark fruit. On the tongue; there is a bitterness present. Its sweet and smoky, and fruity as well. Its also a bit light bodied, in a negative way. Plums, caramel, peat, and english hops sums it up

Poured up on tap at the Dragonmead brewpub with deep amber body and off white head. The mild aroma offers up some cherries, a light amount of caramel and a sense of earthiness. The taste is pretty rich with reduced plum juice, ripe cherries, prunes and raisins as well as caramel followed by a pleasing sense of mineral earthiness.

A ruby-amber pour with some small white-head and decent lacing.  A nice caramel toffee smell.  Had a slick feel to this medium bodied beer.  Slightly sweet with its roasted malts tasting, and I found a bit of smokeyness as well.  A good beer.

On tap at Dragonmead 3-13-09.  Deep amber/brown color.  Smelled like caramel, malt, and grain.  Tasted of lightly roasted malt, nuts, bread crust,, and honey.  Nicely balanced between malty sweet and dry bitter.

On tap at the Dragonmead Brew Pub. Poured a deeper amber color with a smaller sized head. Aromas of caramel, toffee, chocolate, and lighter earthy-peat. Tastes of caramel, peaty, toffee, and all around malty. Alcohol content well hidden.
Cask Conditioned Ale. Excellent creamy head. Had it at Graydons Crossing. Great Malt Character and disguised alcohol content. A brown/amber. The best Ive had from the Royal Oak Scotts.
On tap @ the brew pub: Pours a reddish amber color with no head. Aroma, toffee, and some other rich malts, brown sugar. Flavor, sweet and malty up front, brown sugar, toffee and caramel. Solid brew.

on tap at the brewery..reddish-brown hue with small beige head..aroma of brown sugar, maple syrup, dark fruit, chocolate, and alcohol..heavy sugar in the body with dark fruits, resinous hops, and alcohol..nice

Draft at the Brewery. Pours dark brown with a very thin head. Aroma is malty with some fruit notes. Body is a bit light for my taste and could use some more bitterness. Overall this is a good beer however.
On tap at the brewery. Chestnut colored beer with a very thin head. Earthy, sweet malts, light peat notes, some chocolate. Medium full body, no alcohol prescence. Tasty beer.

Draft... This beer rocks!... Crystal clear, copper ale with a small, creamy, off-white head. The aroma & flavor are vineous, chocolatey and earthy (peat). Good balance. Medium to full-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and lively carbonation. Dry, grassy finish. Excellent Scottish ale.

Sorry but I dont see what these other raters found so appealing in this beer, especially with so many other great Scottish Ales out there.  Clear amber with a brownish head.  Aromas of roasted malt, sweet fruit, touches of smoke, and alcohol.  Flavor consisted of hops, pineapple, grapes, some sweetness.  Overall a weak tasting beer with nothing standing out, and kind of getting washed right out of the mouth.
Finally, a beer with soem character. Pours a dark amber color. has a very light caramel taste to it with a bitter, hoppy aftertaste.

Amber in color witha a tan/off white head.  A sweet berry aroma with hints of alcohol.  A honey taste with a bit of a bitter hint.  There was also some liquor-like notes.  Very taste and easy to drink, almost too easy.

sampler at the brewery. poured deep amber with a light tan head. aroma bitterness, light malts, a touch of sweetness, berries and a touch of alcohol. flavor sourness, malts, honey, alcohol ( burbon) a good beer
Smoky, peppery nose and flavor.  Maltiness comes out under the smoked flavor.  Unique beer.

Hand-pull at the brewery.  Wonderful toffee notes and deep rich mahogany malt tones.  Big body with some hop dressing ... maybe a little too much really for a scotch ale.  Nice peppery yeastiness, a well done scotch ale made better from the cask.

Tap at dragonmead.  Pours a dark brown but quite clear. Small oatmeal colored head that dissipates rapidly.  Smells faintly of medium dark fruit, some caramel/roasted malt and a bit of salt.  Begins very mild, lightly sweet and quite watery.  Has a salty-sweet body with a tad bit of fuggles hops on the finish.  Light bodied, low carbonation.  Somewhat flowery.  Not a whole lot going on.  Smooth.
